articles.title: 'Weird', Long Lost Rocks Could Explain How a Hellish Earth Became Habitable - ScienceAlert
articles.description: Early Earth is often described as 'Hadean' for good reason. Arising from the ashes of a collision that gave us our Moon, the primordial eon was characterized by hellish heat trapped beneath a thick blanket of carbon dioxide and water vapor.

articles.description: Kilonovas are immense explosions caused by neutron stars colliding into each other, sending an intense jet of of high-energy particles through space, experts in Evanston, Illinois explain.
